Posts.Content: MegTX wrote: Greetings, This is my first post so please forgive me if I've tapped into the wrong area.  I was diagnosed 9-17-07 with infiltrating ductal carcinoma and DCIS--had a modified mastectomy on 10-17 and started AC treatments on 11-28--only one more to go before changing to Taxol/Herceptin w/radiation. whew!  I was on medical leave from 10-16 until 1-2.  Being back on the job is good for me mentally but physically exhausting so I've been limited my hours to 5 or 6 per day.  Today, I had a scare with my pasport and had to leave work in order to get it check for "disconnect" or leakage--PTL all is well and appears to be a scar tissue issue.  The reason for my post is how to handle my employer!  Some days she is very cooperative and understanding---today she was extremely hateful asking if my doctors knew that I had a job.  I understand that she's totally stressed out because of my absence and I've explained my treatment plan to her many, many, MANY (grrrrrr) times but she doesn't seem to be listening.  Does anyone have ideas of how I can try to solicit her involvement in my treatment so she doesn't feel so threatened by my absence?  Her attitude really sent me into a tailspin...honestly, she's talking about a job & I'm talking about my LIFE!! Thanks so much for any input. Meg in Texas Dx 9/17/2007, IDC, 2cm, 8/22 nodes, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Employer issue MegTX AnnNYC
